**Describe the bug**
When you assign a default value to a field in a `dataclass`, the field name will cause compile error if you have `cdef extern` function parameters of the same names.

```
Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
    cdef public str foo
    cdef public int bar
    bar = 0

cdef extern from *:
    cdef object dummy_fn(object bar)                               ^
------------------------------------------------------------

client.pyx:12:32: cdef variable 'bar' declared after it is used
```


**To Reproduce**
Code to reproduce the behaviour:
```cython

# cython: language_level=3

from cython.dataclasses cimport dataclass

@dataclass
cdef class Dummy:
    cdef public str foo
    cdef public int bar
    bar = 0

cdef extern from *:
    cdef object dummy_fn(object bar)
```

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Linux
 - Python version 3.10.3
 - Cython version [9cff140813b0ede6d107ed7031052513df251ed9](https://github.com/cython/cython/tree/9cff140813b0ede6d107ed7031052513df251ed9)

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

comment_data.body:
This doesn't actually need dataclasses to fail:

```
# cython: language_level=3

cdef class Dummy:  # a regular class instead of a cdef class also fails....
    bar = 0

cdef extern from *:
    cdef object dummy_fn(object bar)
```

0.29.x gives a warning instead of an error. The commit that changed the warning to an error is 059cecd4e1e84bc44a0dd1abb69a6a973c84082d (although I don't think that commit is wrong... it shouldn't be a warning either)

title: [BUG] @dataclass default value assignment breaks cdef extern block
